request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Access to Designated Record Set
Authorization to Use, Disclose & Release Protected Health Information
Fax submission to Health Information Department
Mail to Health Information Department, 105 W. Eighth Ave Suite 332-C, Spokane, WA 99204

forms.document_type: Patient access request form (HIPAA Right of Access)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A dedicated 2-page fillable PDF form titled 'Patient Request for Access to Designated Record Set' is available for direct download from a facility-specific medical records page, submittable via fax, email, or mail.

red_flags: Liability release clause on patient access form is inappropriate for a Right of Access request
Wet signature required despite 45 fillable fields — no electronic signature option
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form separate from third-party authorization
Five delivery formats including MyChart, Email, Paper, Disc, and Fax
Multi-facility awareness with offer to fax form to other Providence facilities
Centralized medical records portal with per-facility pages and Spanish translations
Proactive SSN disclosure warning on records that may contain social security numbers
Language assistance notices in English, Spanish, and Chinese with TTY access

findability.rationale: Level 5 — prominently available; a single web search returned direct links to a well-organized facility-specific medical records page with clearly labeled PDF downloads and no barriers.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4 — mostly digital with one gap; the form has 45 fillable fields and can be submitted via fax or email, but requires printing for a wet signature, preventing a fully digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4 — well-organized with minor issues; clean 2-page layout with clear instructions and granular record-type selection, but fee language is vague and the liability release clause is confusing on a patient access form.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4 — patient access is clearly accommodated with a dedicated form distinct from third-party release, five delivery formats including MyChart, and multi-facility coordination, though it lacks explicit patient rights statements.

compliance.rationale: Level 4 — minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding; no notarization, no in-person requirement, multiple submission channels, but vague fee disclosure and an unnecessary liability release clause on the patient access form.

overall.summary: Providence Sacred Heart offers a strong patient access experience with a dedicated Right of Access form, five delivery formats, and an exemplary web portal, held back from an A only by the wet signature requirement and vague fee language.
